alert.note: Alert for El Paso; Teller (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 07 at 6:27PM MDT until July 07 at 7:45PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR EAST CENTRAL TELLER AND CENTRAL EL PASO COUNTIES... At 627 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms were decreasing in coverage and intensity across the warned area, however, between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have already fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to locally up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly, due to run-off from earlier heavy rainfall. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Colorado Springs, Manitou Springs, Cimarron Hills, Peterson AFB, Falcon, Security-Widefield, Stratmoor, Schriever AFB and Ellicott, FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
